cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.current_location: about 260 mi south-southeast of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, forecast to graze the southern tip of Baja California Sur late Thursday then curve northwest and away from the peninsula into the Pacific
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Baja California Sur (near or just east of La Paz)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baja California Sur from Puerto Cortes to east of La Paz (hurricane watch); west of La Paz to Loreto and mainland Mexico from Bahia Tempehuaya to Huatabampito (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Baja California Sur from Santa Fe to La Paz (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southern and western Mexico and the southern Baja California peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Only minimal tropical-storm-force winds (â‰¤34 kt) are expected to remain well south of the port; local winds in Los Angeles basin should stay below gale force.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells may reach southern California beaches late this weekend, producing higher surf and rip-current risk, but port operations should not be significantly affected.
